review: We have the Chromecast already but our Fire TV stick just arrived.  It is so amazing and has much more functionality than the others.  It took seconds to set up (plug it into the wall without complaint - it is WORTH the superior performance) and in the minutes since we have set it up we've played games, streamed Pandora, and started watching Prime video.  We are an Apple family (every parent and child has a MacAir, iPad and iPhone) but I also love Amazon (we have 4-5 kindle and kindle fires) even though the functionality is never as good.  This is the exception.  Plug and Play - amazing product.  Well done Amazon!  Now if only my invitation for the Echo would arrive....We just ordered the game controller too.

review: This is a nice addition to my streamers and seems to work as well as the FireTV; however, the big reason I bought it was for its portability and "certified"  Miracast connectivity. I have been in search of the best and most stable Miracast adapter and hoped this would be it.The Miracast connectivity requires the use of the remote and entry to a special screen that you access through settings at the very end of the scroll down.  Should you have to reconnect it, it cant be done seamlessly.  You cant simply go to display/mirror.  The device can not be located absent a two step process, which makes its value less and process cumbersome.I was able to connect my Fire 7"HDX without issues and the connection was stable and no lag for movies.I was not able to connect either a Samsung Note 8 or Sony Z3 compact tablet with Android 4.4.  They both showed connected momentarily but I only had a black screen and then disconnected.Conceivably this is a portable device you can take with you on trips, etc.  However, because full power is required beyond a TV USB connection and a remote, if you have an iPhone. It adds two more items to pack or potentially forget or leave behind.As an aside, I was able to power from the TV's USB port but it only filled half the screen.
